Can an attacker compile the code on non-standard platforms (like WASM or embedded systems) that don't match either condition, causing the function to have undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/aptos.rs] [Function: named_addresses()] [Address shadowing] The NAMED_ADDRESSES map defines critical addresses like 'aptos_framework' -> 0x1, 'vm' -> 0x0. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/aptos.rs] [Function: named_addresses()] [Address parsing vulnerabilities] The function uses NumericalAddress::parse_str() for addresses like '0x1', '0x3', '0xA550C18'. Can an attacker provide malformed address strings that bypass parsing validation but later get interpreted differently by the Move VM, enabling address confusion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/aptos.rs] [Function: named_addresses()] [Special address collision] The addresses 0x0 (vm/vm_reserved), 0x1 (std/aptos_std/aptos_framework), 0x3 (aptos_token), 0x4 (aptos_token_objects), 0x7 (aptos_experimental), 0xA (aptos_fungible_asset), and 0xA550C18 (core_resources) are assigned. Can an attacker deploy malicious modules to these privileged addresses during genesis or reconfiguration? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/aptos.rs] [Function: named_addresses()] [Lazy static initialization race] The NAMED_ADDRESSES is a Lazy<BTreeMap> initialized on first access. Is there a race condition where multiple threads simultaneously initialize this map during validator startup, causing inconsistent address mappings across validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/aptos.rs] [Function: named_addresses()] [Address exhaustion] The function defines 11 named addresses. If an attacker deploys thousands of modules to exhaust the address space near these special addresses, can this cause address collision or confusion in the Move type system? (Medium)

Can an attacker exploit case-insensitive filesystem operations or name resolution to deploy modules with uppercase variants ('Std', 'APTOS_STD') that bypass access controls? (Medium)
